column8: Touring for ideas: Dr Wee and Pahang MCA chairman Datuk Hoh Khai Mun (fourth left) with some of the Chinese new village heads who will be visiting Kunming on a study tour fully sponsored by China.Twenty new village heads will be visiting Kunming, the capital of Yunnan province, early April on a study tour fully sponsored by the Chinese government.Touted as one of China’s most liveable cities by Lonely Planet and a popular tourist destination, Kun­ming is a great place for the chiefs to learn how to modernise their villages, said Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong, the Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department in charge of new villages.“It’s a successful example of how a village transformed itself into a modern thriving city,” Dr Wee told reporters at Wisma MCA yesterday.Most Chinese new villages, he said, were aging and losing their youth to cities due to their slow pace of economic development and lack of job opportunities.“As such, the Government has identified 20 Chinese new villages in Perak, Selangor, Negri Sembilan, Malacca, Pahang and Johor that have the potential to become tourist attractions.”http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017..._medium=twitter
